title: Travelling_Cushite
author: Travelling_Cushite
content: Hey all,Second year Bitcoiner here.  Spend most of the time stacking but now have been using for a lot (feels good not feeding the fiat machine). But now I want to help further the Bitcoin economy than just mere buying. So I set up a new marketplace called Camel Road (yes it's based off Silk Road but minus the drugs). The marketplace is dedicated to  up & coming business/side hustles in the following categories: Home Appliances, Fragrances, Food stuff (spices, bagged foods), motors (car parts), textiles (fabrics), tech and services. Commission is at 7% and the modes of payment are Bitcoin (with Lightning option) & Bitcoin CashIf you any questions let me know.Website is here: https://camelroad.net/

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: Travelling_Cushite on April 27, 2023, 12:02:28 AMIf you any questions let me know.Considering that you abandoned your previous project [bitsuuq] in its early stages, how can you assure your potential users this new marketplace is not going to suffer the same fate?I noticed you've mentioned "scam protection" as one of its features, but after reading the rules, I'm still not convinced if there are enough preventive measures!

comments.author: Travelling_Cushite
comments.body: Hi,I haven't given up on BitSuuq (now Silicon Exchange). Silicon Exchange is a marketplace focused on electronic and geared towards tinkers and electrical engineers. I wanted to make another marketplace that had more broader options for a wider audience. But because of your comment, I will put more focus on Silicon Exchange and it will be my main focus. I have already changed the payment processor for it to be solely Bitcoin. Thank you for motivating me.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: I can't even access your website. It shows an SSL error and I can't really see anything about your website, granted I used a VPN to access it. Did you block some IPs from some countries or something? As far as my internet experience goes with the VPN I use right now, even if they got blocked by some services I still get a notif or explanation about it.How will you guarantee that the buyer won't scam the seller or vice versa btw?

comments.author: WillyAp
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on April 29, 2023, 01:41:52 PMHow will you guarantee that the buyer won't scam the seller or vice versa btw?There is no guarantee for Scam on any exchange. With enough prep time plus resources you can fool any security measure.Checked Feedbacks are close but still you can get scammed from someone who has a bad time. Even after 10 Years of good standings.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: I browsed some data on the first page and the distribution of products is very random, as the products that appeared to me are:Male perfume to BMW replacement Tire to Spare breaks (NISSAN)What is the relationship between all these products or why do they appear in this order?The design needs a lot of work and you need a good marketing campaign to get more offers.Quote from: joniboini on April 29, 2023, 01:41:52 PMI can't even access your website. It shows an SSL error and I can't really see anything about your website, granted I used a VPN to access it.It works fine with me, I'm using Tor browser.
